channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @hondanhon My first guess is that no one ever experimented with adding dye to them.
item.source:markdown: @hondanhon My first guess is that no one ever experimented with adding dye to them.

item.description: @EladNehorai It’s not like classical Zionism was ever at odds with what Diaspora Jews thought was in their best interests. Oh, wait… https://t.co/DfDt7i7x2L
item.source:markdown: @EladNehorai It’s not like classical Zionism was ever at odds with what Diaspora Jews thought was in their best interests. Oh, wait… https://t.co/DfDt7i7x2L

item.description:
@Jacob_Labendz Thoughts: 1) The Mishna was ostensibly a product of pagan Rome. 2) It sort of depends on what going on religiously with the rest of the Roman Empire. Pre-Christian Judaism seems to have been somewhat compelling in pre-Christian Rome.

@Jacob_Labendz 3) Poul Anderson has a story, "In the House of Sorrows," that looks at a 20th century Europe where Judaism didn't survive the first Exile and thus there was no Christianity.

@Jacob_Labendz 4) If you like Jewish counterfactuals, check out Other Covenants, an anthology of Jewish alternate history stories and poems, now on Kickstarter: https://t.co/EsaEUeqFp0
Beloved Conservative Relative has suggested that Trump may be getting the Dreyfus treatment by the FBI. How’s your morning going?
item.source:markdown: Beloved Conservative Relative has suggested that Trump may be getting the Dreyfus treatment by the FBI. How’s your morning going?

item.description: @safarishane @Acyn So you’re saying Hilary doesn’t have atoms in her personal residence?
item.source:markdown: @safarishane @Acyn So you’re saying Hilary *doesn’t* have atoms in her personal residence?

item.description: @pdnell @jh_swanson @WriteNunya Say what you want about the Jews, but at least we love our (possibly apocryphal) Golda quotes.
item.source:markdown: @pdnell @jh_swanson @WriteNunya Say what you want about the Jews, but at least we love our (possibly apocryphal) Golda quotes.

item.description: @DandiaAsad Money buys the ability to live without knowing how anything works.
item.source:markdown: @DandiaAsad Money buys the ability to live without knowing how anything works.

item.description: @Cato_of_Utica On the bright side, Jerry Pournelle wasn’t there.
item.source:markdown: @Cato_of_Utica On the bright side, Jerry Pournelle wasn’t there.

item.description: The funny/sad thing is that Jimmy Carter probably has more nuclear secrets still in his brain despite 40 years of declassification and forgetting than does Two Scoops, who possibly never read most of the secrets he stole.
item.source:markdown: The funny/sad thing is that Jimmy Carter probably has more nuclear secrets still in his brain despite 40 years of declassification and forgetting than does Two Scoops, who possibly never read most of the secrets he stole.

item.description: @protecttruth_ This is going to really hurt him with ex-military people throughout the military and beyond. Regardless of there being actionable launch codes, lots of people in uniform take classification very seriously.
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ This is going to really hurt him with ex-military people throughout the military and beyond. Regardless of there being actionable launch codes, lots of people in uniform take classification very seriously.

item.description: @protecttruth_ I also think attacking the FBI verbally and inciting others to kill FBI agents didn’t endear him to certain FBI circles.
item.source:markdown: @protecttruth_ I also think attacking the FBI verbally and inciting others to kill FBI agents didn’t endear him to certain FBI circles.

item.description: @joshtpm I think one would have to be a Donatist to deny that the former guy had that power.
item.source:markdown: @joshtpm I think one would have to be a Donatist to deny that the former guy had that power.

item.description: @DanSlott So you’re saying only Multiple Man can handle tur demands of the modern presidency?
item.source:markdown: @DanSlott So you’re saying only Multiple Man can handle tur demands of the modern presidency?

item.description: @ChadAChavez @Litejedi @joshtpm @ijkijKevin Think stupider. I think he just doesn’t like being told what to do, so who took papers that crossed his desk and didn’t give them back when asked.

item.description: @RokhlK Did it contain any nuclear particles?
item.source:markdown: @RokhlK Did it contain any nuclear particles?

item.description:
@gerrycanavan @trekonomics I think he just has problems with authority. It’s all just a dominance game for him. Yes, he’s venal, but he’s also deeply stupid.

@gerrycanavan @trekonomics Being stupid means you don’t understand basic things about your line of work. What happened to Patreus and Sandy Berger never registers — or you see that they didn’t get the high end of the possible sentence, and figure you can wiggle out too.

@gerrycanavan @trekonomics I assume that bureaucrats who are read into classified info learn to take it seriously — akin to how my dad taught me to handle a gun, a lesson he learned in the army back in the day.

@gerrycanavan @trekonomics But there’s a level of stupidity where you tune out the explicit lessons and don’t pick up on any of the quiet cultural signals surrounding the matter.

@gerrycanavan @trekonomics That’s why Ari Fleischer is so flustered. The guy committed a federal crime, turned down multiple chances to come clean and be forgiven, and gained absolutely nothing by it.

@gerrycanavan @trekonomics It’s exactly like Hillary’s email server only ten times stupider and ten times more criminal.
@RokhlK Who among us?
item.source:markdown: @RokhlK Who among us?
